intro: Volutaria lippii subsp. medians, commonly known as the western sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a low-growing perennial herb with slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, typically arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months.
